headline: Registered Nurse
summary: Culturally competent nurse offering the strengths of versatility as an RN and unbiased lenses. Proudly delivered nursing care to in the areas of Immigration & Customs Enforcement (ICE)âCorrections and rural Indian Health Service, Hopi Tribe

defaultPosition.description:
-Demonstrated exceptional poise and situational awareness as a high-level nursing care provider in a multicultural setting with >20,000 detainees per year. 

-Served in an Occupational Safety and Health Officer capacity while also balancing the responsibilities of a lead clinical coordinator, overseeing yearly immunizations and delivering nursing services to a population with chronic care needs

-Triaged patients, determining need for emergency intervention for drug and alcohol abuse, mental health demise, and other behavioral health complications
defaultPosition.title: Clinical Research Nurse

positions.description:
-Demonstrated exceptional poise and situational awareness as a high-level nursing care provider in a multicultural setting with >20,000 detainees per year. 

-Served in an Occupational Safety and Health Officer capacity while also balancing the responsibilities of a lead clinical coordinator, overseeing yearly immunizations and delivering nursing services to a population with chronic care needs

-Triaged patients, determining need for emergency intervention for drug and alcohol abuse, mental health demise, and other behavioral health complications
positions.title: Clinical Research Nurse

positions.description:
- Medical Surgical nursing experience, demonstrating ability to quickly link disease pathologies with conditions on a rural Native American reservationâas one of only 2 nurses in charge of delivering medical surgical and emergent care to 11,000-person population

- Functioned as charge nurse and ensured the quality delivery of patient care from nursing assessments through implementation, reassessment, and interventions for the newborn, pediatric, adult, geriatric, pre/post-natal women, and newborn population

-Demonstrated acute assessment skills and ability connect with patients, offering support and guidance: assessed women for dilation, fundal heights, fetal tones, and conducted many post-partum women checks under the tutelage of OBGYN/midwife.

- Connected symptoms with conditions, after careful monitoring of patients; measured vital signs, detected abnormalities, including adverse reactions to medications; caught early signs and prevented toxic shock syndromes.

-Strong patient educator. Well-regarded as an RN with personal consultative skills. Counseled new mothers on the topic of breastfeeding and proper latching and diet/nutrition education. Helped patients manage post-partum depression
positions.title: Registered Nurse - Inpatient / Labor and Delivery

positions.description:
- Ensured patient safety through use of broad scope of care, meeting the needs of patient and family members including within limited resources. Focused on patient convalesce, family dynamics, and womenâs health

-Coordinated care through a case-management approach, connecting patients to resources in social services, behavioral health, primary care, nutrition, and diabetes
positions.title: Public Health Nurse

positions.description:
- Entrusted with performance improvement projects, which had critical impact on the enhancement of lab completion, turn-around times, and nursing compliances. 

- Identified areas in need of overhaul and culture change. Championed the use of a tracking system to boost team-based nursing, efficiency, safety, and quality
positions.title: Clinical Staff Nurse
